H0.text: Earthworms like the taste of dirt better than sand is an idea that can be tested experimentally, as one of the four earthworm behavior ideas Alice wrote down for her science project focused on how earthworm behavior helps it survive.

H1.text: Earthworms are happier in black dirt than red dirt is an idea that can be tested experimentally by Alice, who designed a science project to investigate how earthworm behavior helps it survive.

H2.text: Earthworms exist to decompose decaying materials is an idea that Alice can experimentally test among the four ideas she wrote down for her science project on how earthworm behavior helps it survive.

H3.text: Earthworms will move away from direct light sources is the idea that can be tested experimentally in Aliceâ€™s science project, which focuses on how earthworm behavior helps it survive.

A4.text: Investigations in the United States show that fresh earthworm casts are five times richer in available nitrogen, seven times richer in available phosphates, and 11 times richer in available potassium than the surrounding upper 6 inches (150 mm) of soil.

A5.text: The earthworm activity aerates and mixes the soil, and is conducive to mineralization of nutrients and their uptake by vegetation.
